newsitem.title: INDIA: India Jan foreign fund inflows at $55 mln. [CORRECTED 04:53 GMT]
newsitem.headline: India Jan foreign fund inflows at $55 mln. [CORRECTED 04:53 GMT]

text.p: Foreign investors registered on Indian stock exchanges invested $55 million (corrects from billion) in the two weeks to January 15, the Business Standard newspaper said on Monday.
The newspaper said inflows by foreign institutional investors (FIIs) -- which hit $12.2 million in the first ten days of January -- jumped sharply last week.
It said latest data available from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) showed the investment had touched $55 million. SEBI officials were not immediately available for comment.
